title: What do I need to legally use copyrighted music in my game? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: I am not sure if your question asks whether you need to use “copyrighted music” for your game or if you need to comply with copyrights if you use someone else’s music in your game. I respond based on US law. Copyright law protects music, and the owner of the composition and in some instances, the owner of the recording performance, have exclusive rights to make copies, distribute, make derivate works, and to publicly perform the music. You will need at minimum, to get a synchronization license to synch the music with your game. There are other options. There are resources on the web where you can get royalty free music tracks.
You need a licensing agreement with the record publisher. Just like TV and movies. Media companies hire a Music Supervisor to arrange these deals.
